messages.content:
Dear Friend,

The referendum result was bad enough.

But when I saw Labour MPs join with UKIP and the Conservatives to vote for a damaging hard Brexit, it felt even worse.

This isn't what I want for my children or my country.

Isolation isn't good for Britain. Being outside the single market isn't good for Britain. Ignoring the damage that hard Brexit does to jobs, food prices and industry isn't good for Britain.

This election is our chance to get the strong opposition Britain needs.

That's why I'm asking you to support the Liberal Democrats this time. The fight to stop a hard Brexit isn't over. The people, not Theresa May, can and should have the final say on the Brexit deal in a referendum.

That's what we’ll be fighting for with your support.

A vote for the Lib Dems is also a vote to stop more harsh cuts to our NHS and our schools. It's a vote against heartless cuts to benefits for bereaved families.

When Labour had the chance to stand up to this Government on Brexit they failed. I thought the Labour Party shared our values of openness and tolerance - but instead they've left many of their supporters feeling angry and betrayed.

Please join with me and help change Britain's future in this election.

Thanks and best wishes,
Tim Farron

Tim Farron
Leader of the Liberal Democrats

PS I'd love to hear your views on Brexit and other issues. Please do complete the enclosed survey.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Fight to stop a hard Brexit and advocate for a final say on the Brexit deal in a referendum.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Stop Cuts to NHS and Schools
keyPolicies.policyDescription: A vote for the Liberal Democrats is a vote to stop harsh cuts to the NHS and schools and to combat heartless cuts to welfare benefits.
